intro: Petrophile macrostachya, commonly known as the narrow-leaf rock-heath, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its woody structure and dense, evergreen foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in coastal or heathland environments. Its flowers are usually small and white or pink, arranged in spikes, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. Petrophile macrostachya is well adapted to harsh, nutrient-poor conditions and is an important component of its native ecosystems.
